American Robin.description: A familiar songbird with a gray back, reddish-orange breast, and often seen hopping on lawns searching for earthworms.
American Robin.lifespan: Average 2 years in the wild, up to 14 years recorded.

Blue Jay.description: A large, noisy songbird known for its bright blue, white, and black plumage and its intelligence.
Blue Jay.lifespan: Average 7 years in the wild, up to 26 years recorded.

Northern Cardinal.description: A striking bird where the male is bright red and the female is reddish-brown. Known for its prominent crest and cheerful song.
Northern Cardinal.lifespan: Average 3 years in the wild, up to 15 years recorded.
